intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. subrhoeadifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow composite flowers in late summer. Its inflorescence consists of a single flower head with ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. It is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
